sections.content:
Rehabilitation Services - Outpatient Chiropractic (Manipulative) Treatment
What are rehabilitation services? Health care services that help a person get back a functional skill that has been lost because of sickness or injury.
What are chiropractic (manipulative) services? Treatment that focuses on the spine and nervous system to help with pain and overall health.
Outpatient services must be given by a doctor or a licensed therapist.
Want more information?
View the glossary for definitions.

UHC Network
Primary Doctor:
20% co-insurance
After you pay the deductible.
Specialist:
20% co-insurance
After you pay the deductible.
Your first 3 visits for any combination of chiropractic (manipulative) and physical therapy for new low back pain may be covered at no charge.
Is prior authorization needed?
No
sections.header: Your cost if you use Network benefits

sections.content:
50% co-insurance
After you pay the deductible.
Is prior authorization needed?
No
sections.header: Your cost if you use Out-of-Network benefits

sections.content:
Limited to 20 Visits Per Calendar Year
If the service is provided in a doctor’s office, additional co-pays, deductible or co-insurance may apply.
Your benefits may be denied or reduced if you are not improving or your treatment goals have been met.
· The Orthopedic Health Support (OHS) program is for members looking to have spinal fusion, disc procedures or joint replacements. This program offers UHG employees access to high quality facilities and surgeons as well as a nurse for pain management and support both before and after surgery.
· Enrollment in Orthopedic Health Support (OHS) is required for coverage of any inpatient or outpatient knee, hip or spine surgery. You must contact Health Care Advisor prior to surgery to enroll in the program in order for the surgery to be considered a Covered Health Service under the plan.
· Non-Network surgeries will not be covered.
· For more information about OHS or to join, please call a Health Care Advisor at 1-800-357-1371 with questions

sections.content:
Rehabilitation Services - Outpatient Physical Therapy
What are rehabilitation services?
Rehabilitation services are health care services from a doctor or licensed therapist that help a person get back or improve a functional skill that has been lost because of sickness or injury.
Need help understanding health care terms?
View the glossary for definitions.

UHC Network
Primary Doctor:
20% coinsurance
After you pay the deductible.
Specialist:
20% coinsurance
After you pay the deductible.
Your first 3 visits for any combination of chiropractic (manipulative) and physical therapy for new low back pain may be covered at no charge.
You do not need to get prior authorization before getting this care.
sections.header: Your cost if you use Network benefits

sections.content:
50% coinsurance
After you pay the deductible.
You do not need to get prior authorization before getting this care.
sections.header: Your cost if you use Out-of-Network benefits

sections.content:
Limited to 60 Visits Per Calendar Year combined with occupational therapy.
You may have to pay an additional copay, deductible or coinsurance for services provided in a doctor's office.
Your benefits may be denied or reduced if you are not improving or your treatment goals have been met.

sections.content:
Habilitative Services - Chiropractic (Manipulative) Treatment
What are habilitative services? Health care services that help a person learn or improve a functional skill that should be present but isn’t because of sickness or injury.
Services must be given by a doctor or a licensed therapist.
Want more information?
View the glossary for definitions.

Inpatient
The amount you pay is based on where the covered health service is provided.
Is prior authorization needed?
No
Outpatient
UHC Network

20% co-insurance
After you pay the deductible.
Your first 3 visits for any combination of chiropractic (manipulative) and physical therapy for new low back pain may be covered at no charge.
Is prior authorization needed?
No
